text: Dieter Enders (17 March 1946 – 29 June 2019) was a German organic chemist. He was known for his work creating asymmetric synthesis, such as using modified prolines as asymmetric auxiliaries. He was born in Butzbach, Hesse. Enders worked at RWTH Aachen University in Aachen, North Rhine-Westphalia. Enders died on 29 June 2019 in Aachen at the age of 73.Dieter Enders (1946 – 2019) ==References== ==Other websites== * Dieter Enders Home Page * Curriculum Vitae Prof. Dr. Dieter Enders Category:1946 births Category:2019 deaths Category:German chemists
title: Dieter Enders
